''[[CNN Philippines]]'' At the same time, [[National Bureau of Investigation (Philippines)|National Bureau of Investigation]] has issued a [[subpoena]] against CEO [[Maria Ressa]], former reporter Reynaldo Santos, and businessman Benjamin Bitanga for violating the anti-cybercrime act.{{cite news|title=Group defends Rappler in online libel case|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/01/20/group-defends-rappler-in-online-libel-case.html|accessdate=January 20, 2018|work=CNN Philippines}} The protest was attended by 300 people, wearing black T-shirts, against the attacks on press freedom by the government.{{cite news|title=Press freedom wears black in media rallies|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/961968/press-freedom-wears-black-in-media-rallies|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]}}{{cite news|title=Groups protest 'attacks' on press freedom|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/01/20/black-friday-protest-press-freedom.html|work=CNN Philippines}} Rappler is known to be critical of the Duterte administration.{{cite news|title=Sociologist: Duterte's media criticism has grave implications on news practice|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/01/17/nicole-curato-on-rappler-SEC-decision.html|work=CNN Philippines}} Presidential Spokesperson [[Harry Roque]] said that Duterte has no involvement in the SEC's decision.[http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/01/16/Rappler-Ressa-Malacanang-hand-license-revocation.html "Rappler sees Malacañang hand in license revocation"]. ''CNN Philippines''. Roque said that the Friday protest "is a testament that freedom is alive and democracy is alive in the Philippines."[http://www.interaksyon.com/black-friday-bloggers-for-freedom-blast-moves-to-silence-scare-media-as-palace-vows-maximum-tolerance/ "Watch | Black Friday: ‘Bloggers for Freedom’ blast ‘moves to silence, scare’ media as Palace vows maximum tolerance"]. ''[[News5]]''. Nevertheless, the revocation was widely condemned by the opposition figures such as Kadamay chairperson Gloria Arellano, Senators Leila de Lima'''Gloria Arellano''': "Sinasanay na ang mamamayan sa kalakaran ng karahasan at panunupil (The masses are being trained in the ways of violence and silencing of dissent)."
'''Leila de Lima''': "Wala na talagang tatalo sa kapal ng mukha ni Duterte at ng kanyang rehimen," she said. "Huwag magwalang kibo o magkibit-balikat lang sa hayagang kasinungalingan, kayabangan, at pag-abuso sa kapangyarihan ng rehimeng Duterte. Dahil kung ngayon, Rappler, malamang bukas, ikaw na." ("Nothing will beat the shamelessness of Duterte and his regime. Let us not brush aside the lies, the boastfulness and the abuses of the Duterte regime. If it's Rappler today, it might be you tomorrow.") ([http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/01/20/black-friday-protest-press-freedom.html Source from CNN Philippines]) ([https://web.archive.org/web/20180121071257/http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/01/20/black-friday-protest-press-freedom.html Archived] from the original). and Antonio Trillanes — who said that the decision is similar to Duterte's strategy against De Lima's imprisonment for drug charges,{{cite news|title=Trillanes calls on Senate to defend De Lima, press freedom, right to life|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/196573-trillanes-privilege-speech-de-lima-press-freedom-extrajudicial-killings|work=[[Rappler]]}} National Union of Journalists of the Philippines,[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JGwP8vnf4nU "TV Patrol: 'Black Friday' protest at concert, isinagawa sa UP"] (in Tagalog). [[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]] — via [[YouTube]]. Anakbayan, UP Diliman, and the anonymous critic from ''[[The New York Times]]''.[https://web.archive.org/web/20180117015119/https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/16/opinion/duterte-free-press-philippines.html "After Killing Spree, Is a Free Press Mr. Duterte’s Next Victim?"]. ''[[The New York Times]]''. Archived from the [https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/16/opinion/duterte-free-press-philippines.html]. Other bloggers and journalists were also present at the protest.{{cite news|title=Media practitioners, bloggers gear up for Black Friday protest in QC|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/961756/media-practitioners-gear-up-for-black-friday-protest-in-qc-black-friday-protest-mass-action-press-freedom-nujp-bloggers-journalists|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]}} === Tax Reform for Acceleration and Inclusion Act (TRAIN law) === {{further|Tax Reform for Acceleration and Inclusion Act}} Duterte signed the Tax Reform for Acceleration and Inclusion Act, also known as TRAIN law, on December 19, 2017 that lowers personal income taxes while increases the price of fuel, cars, coal and sugar-sweetened drinks.{{cite news |title=Duterte signs tax reform, 2018 budget into law |url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/business/12/19/17/duterte-signs-tax-reform-2018-budget-into-law |work=ABS-CBN News}} Since then, it was met by the protests among the groups, who said that the TRAIN law made the people (especially poor) burden.''"Tila, unli na daw kasi ang pahirap na dinaranas ngayon ng mga masa."'' @ 0:12-16 ([https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uLdDs0g5vec ABS-CBN News via YouTube]) The main phase of protests against TRAIN Law occurred on May and June 2018, with some of the group calling to junk the TRAIN Law by launching the signature campaign.See the following protests:
{{bulleted list | {{cite news|title=TV Patrol: Pag-akyat ng presyo ng langis, iprinotesta, idinaing|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BOYm7BpnWjQ|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} | {{cite news|title=Bandila: Ilang negosyante, umaaray sa pagtaas ng presyo ng mga bilihin|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9IXA6sIxHfg|accessdate=May 25, 2018|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} ''Note: If necessary, skip to 1:22.'' | {{cite news|title=Bandila: Signature campaign kontra TRAIN Law, inilunsad|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QCA3x5AkCqE|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} | {{cite news|title='Wag lang puro papogi': Mga opisyal ng gobyerno, kinastigo ng labor group|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uLdDs0g5vec|accessdate=May 29, 2018|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} | {{cite web |title=TV Patrol - Jun 1, 2018 |url=http://www.iwantv.com.ph/tv/show/TV-Patrol/Episode-June-1-2018?s=5&e=163277 |publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[i Want TV]]}} {{subscription required}} ''Note: Skip to 15:21.'' | {{cite news |title=TV Patrol: Ilang guro at estudyante, nagprotesta sa unang araw ng pasukan|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BkIQpmt3Uz8|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} | {{cite news |title=TV Patrol - Jun 22, 2018 |url=http://www.iwantv.com.ph/tv/show/TV-Patrol/Episode-June-22-2018?s=5&e=164345|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[i Want TV]]}} {{subscription required}} ''Note: Skip to 17:12.'' }} === Anniversary of People Power Revolution === [[File:Edsa-32b.png|thumb|275px|Protesters demonstrate during the 32nd anniversary of People Power Revolution.]] The February 23 walkout by thousands of students from different universities nationwide,{{cite news|title=Oldest alliance of college editors to stage nationwide protests February 23|url=https://www.rappler.com/move-ph/196585-cegp-stage-nationwide-protests-duterte-attack-press-freedom|work=Rappler}} along with other several opponent sectors, occurred when they protest against the jeepney phaseout and ongoing martial law in the Mindanao.{{cite news|title=#WalkOutPH trends on Twitter as millennials fight for press freedom, human rights|url=https://www.rappler.com/move-ph/196730-walkoutph-trends-twitter-millennials-press-freedom-human-rights|work=[[Rappler]]}} The hashtag #WalkOutPH reached more than 3,000 tweets and at least 2.6 million impressions on [[Twitter]].{{cite news|title=Filipino youth lead nationwide 'walkout' for freedom and democracy|url=https://www.rappler.com/move-ph/196750-filipino-youth-lead-march-freedom-democracy|work=Rappler}} Demonstrators commemorate the 32nd anniversary of [[People Power Revolution]] (also dubbed as "People Werpa"){{cite news|title=It's red, blue, white for 32nd anniversary of Edsa People Power|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/971232/edsa-people-power-revolution-colors-commemorate-anniversary|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]}} on February 25, 2018, which was successfully ended the dictatorship of Marcos on the same day of 1986.{{cite news|title=Duterte to skip Edsa People Power anniversary rites anew|url=http://www.sunstar.com.ph/manila/local-news/2018/02/24/duterte-skip-edsa-people-power-anniversary-rites-anew-590594|work=SunStar}} According to Presidential Spokesperson Harry Roque, Duterte will not attend the event but instead "the President will be in his home province in Davao City". Last year, Duterte also did attend the event. As the day approaches, several groups including students, activists, and other opponents held the protests against Duterte administration actions.{{cite news|title=In Photos: Protesters mark 32nd anniversary of People Power|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/196819-photos-protesters-32nd-anniversary-edsa-people-power-revolution|work=[[Rappler]]}} An online poll conducted by Communications Assistant Secretary [[Mocha Uson]], stating ''"Naniniwala ba kayo na ang 1986 EDSA PEOPLE POWER ay isang produkto ng FAKE NEWS???"'' ("Do you think the 1986 EDSA People Power is a product of fake news?"), which garnered 84% voted "yes" out of 61,800 respondents.[https://web.archive.org/web/20180227062953/https://www.rappler.com/nation/196939-harry-roque-1986-edsa-revolution-not-fake-news-mocha-uson "Roque: 1986 EDSA Revolution not 'fake news'"]. Archived from the [https://www.rappler.com/nation/196939-harry-roque-1986-edsa-revolution-not-fake-news-mocha-uson original]. ''[[Rappler]]'' However, Harry Roque said that the event is not 'fake news'. === Labor Day protests === [[File:Mayo Uno 2018.jpg|thumb|Labor Day 2018 mobilization]] The contractualization defines "a practice where a company hires contractual workers only when is necessary" while "endo" (end of contract) "refers to the scheme that corrupt companies exercise to abuse their workers."{{cite web|title='Endo' in the Philippines|url=http://asiapro.coop/blog/endo-in-the-philippines/|publisher=Asia Pro|accessdate=April 18, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180418070021/http://asiapro.coop/blog/endo-in-the-philippines/|archivedate=April 18, 2018}}{{cite news|title=All You Need to Know About Contractualization|url=http://asiapro.coop/contractualization-all-need-know/|work=Asia Pro}} The above-mentioned was heavily opposed by the labor groups as they urged Duterte to sign executive order (EO) that will regulate contractualization.{{cite news|title=Landmark EO on 'endo' awaits Duterte's signature|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/982406/landmark-eo-on-endo-awaits-dutertes-signature|accessdate=April 18, 2018|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]}} According to Presidential Spokesperson Harry Roque, the EO will be possibly signed on May 1, Labor Day.{{cite news|author1=Pia Ranada|title=Malacañang: Duterte EO on 'endo' to 'side with labor forces'|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/200348-malacanang-duterte-executive-order-endo-labor-forces|accessdate=April 18, 2018|work=[[Rappler]]}} However, on April 19, Labor Secretary Silvestre Bello III confirmed that there will be no longer an executive order, and, instead, the Congress will be the one to pass it.{{cite news|title=Palace sides with Bello: No EO vs contractrualization, up to Congress to pass law|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/200599-dole-no-eo-contractualization-congress-pass-law|work=[[Rappler]]}} On May 1, 2018, about 20,000 protesters{{NoteTag|Another source said 6,920 from the police estimate.{{cite news|title=Fewer Labor Day protesters show up than what PNP had expected in Metro|url=https://news.mb.com.ph/2018/05/01/fewer-labor-day-protesters-show-up-than-what-pnp-had-expected-in-metro/|work=[[Manila Bulletin]]}}}} clad in red shirts gathered at Mendiola for the much awaited of "endo" termination, featuring Duterte's effigies.{{cite news|title=Labor groups dismayed by signed 'employer-backed' EO vs endo|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/201511-groups-dismayed-employer-backed-eo-labor-day-2018|work=[[Rappler]]}} Duterte signed the executive order about ending of end-of-contract scheme or "endo".{{cite news|title=Duterte signs EO protecting workers' right to security of tenure|url=https://news.mb.com.ph/2018/05/01/duterte-signs-eo-protecting-workers-right-to-security-of-tenure/|work=[[Manila Bulletin]]}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20180501072103/https://news.mb.com.ph/2018/05/01/duterte-signs-eo-protecting-workers-right-to-security-of-tenure/ Archived] from the original. However, what Duterte signed about is for the employers not the workers — not the EO they had drafted,{{cite news|title='Walang silbi': Labor groups reject Duterte's EO vs endo|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/201546-eo-contractualization-rally-may-1-labor-day-2018|work=[[Rappler]]}} much to the dismay of the labor groups. Before that, Duterte promised on February to signed the EO but it was postponed to March 15{{cite news|title=Labor groups hit Duterte: Where's signed EO vs contractualization?|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/198224-labor-groups-duterte-contractualization-endo-executive-order-march-deadline|work=[[Rappler]]}} and then on April 16. The signed EO garnered mixed reception from various groups.{{cite news|title=Duterte's EO vs 'endo' draws mixed reactions|url=https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2018/05/01/1811204/dutertes-eo-vs-endo-draws-mixed-reactions|work=[[The Philippine Star]]}} Therefore, labor groups vowed to held a larger protest until the contractualization is ended.{{cite news|title=TV Patrol: Mga protesta sa Labor Day, sumentro sa panawagang wakasan ang 'endo'|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GDuRzUv1_I8|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} === Removal of Sereno by the Supreme Court === {{further|Quo warranto petition against Maria Lourdes Sereno}} [[File:Former CJ Sereno.jpg|Ousted Chief Justice Maria Lourdes Sereno (left) addresses her crowd of supporters after her peers in the Supreme Court voted to oust her based on the solicitor general's ''[[quo warranto]]'' petition on May 11, 2018|thumb|200px]] DemonstrationsSee the demonstrations: *[https://web.archive.org/web/20180305061400/https://www.facebook.com/PTVph/photos/a.248547658539245.61071.143947355665943/2035456206515039/?type=3&theater "JUST IN: Mga taga-suporta ni CJ Sereno, nagtungo sa SC para igiit na wag idiin ang punong mahistrado. | via Kenneth Paciente"]. Archived from the [https://www.facebook.com/PTVph/photos/a.248547658539245.61071.143947355665943/2035456206515039/?type=3&theater original]. [[People's Television Network|PTV]] — via [[Facebook]]. *{{cite news|title=Groups to hold vigil for Sereno as SC starts summer session in Baguio|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/199429-groups-vigil-chief-justice-sereno-supreme-court-baguio-session|work=[[Rappler]]}} staged by the supporters of [[Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the Philippines|Supreme Court Chief Justice]] [[Maria Lourdes Sereno]] occurred, following her impeachment process filed against her{{cite news|title=Palace: Quo warranto petition vs Sereno 'unprecedented'|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/03/05/18/palace-quo-warranto-petition-vs-sereno-unprecedented|work=ABS-CBN News}}{{cite news|title=Gadon complaint over SALN shows desperation: Sereno lawyer|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/01/29/18/gadon-complaint-over-saln-shows-desperation-sereno-lawyer|work=ABS-CBN News}} and her subsequent indefinite leave.{{cite news|title=Sereno asserts 'indefinite leave is not a resignation'|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/03/01/18/sereno-asserts-indefinite-leave-is-not-a-resignation|work=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]}}{{cite news|title=Sereno to go on 'indefinite leave'|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/02/28/18/sereno-to-go-on-indefinite-leave|work=ABS-CBN News}} The main reasons for the impeachment proceedings, according to the complainant, lawyer Larry Gadon, was that Sereno allegedly failed to declare her [[Statement of Assets, Liabilities and Net worth]] (SALN) and was also responsible for tax misdeclarations and unauthorized expenses.{{cite news|title=25 lawmakers endorse impeachment complaint vs Sereno|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/180651-lawmakers-endorse-impeachment-complaint-chief-justice-sereno|work=[[Rappler]]}} On April 10, a video showing Gadon approaches in front of the Sereno supporters and the blocking police officers several meters away, raises his middle finger and shouts "''Mga bobo''" ({{lang-en|Idiots}}),See the videos of Gadon: *{{cite news|title=Gadon curses, raises middle finger at Sereno supporters|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EGq3yxJmBRo|publisher=[[Rappler]]|via=[[YouTube]]}} *{{cite news |title=Hindi mga BOBO Certification of Atty Larry Gadon |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZUcMP8rbvow |via=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=October 19, 2018}} prompting the supporters to filed the complaint against Gadon nine days later.{{cite web|title=DZMM TeleRadyo: Third disbarment case filed vs Gadon for screaming expletives|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-X6MZmmEaD0|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} After Solicitor General Jose Calida filed a ''[[quo warranto]]'' petition against her,[http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/652911/law-faculties-let-sereno-impeachment-trial-begin-quo-warranto-petition-unconstitutional/story/ "Law profs say quo warranto vs. Sereno unconstitutional"]. GMA News. Retrieved 11 May 2018. the Supreme Court voted for the removal of Sereno from the high court on May 11, 2018 with the votes of 8-6.{{cite news|title=Point by point: Why Supreme Court granted ouster petition vs Sereno|url=https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2018/05/11/1814337/point-point-why-supreme-court-granted-ouster-petition-vs-sereno|accessdate=May 11, 2018|work=[[The Philippine Star]]}} At the same time, supporters of Sereno gathered at the streets near the Supreme Court.{{cite news|title=ABS-CBN News Livestream: Sereno supporters gather ahead of SC decision on quo warranto plea|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aV85CkN5c98|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} Politicians expressed condemnation of ousting Sereno.{{cite news|title=Mga opisyal ng gobyerno, hati sa pagpapatalsik kay Sereno|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yE1GmSUFp7Q|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} In the aftermath of ousting Sereno, a prayer rally and protests was conducted in Bacolod,{{cite news|title=Diocese of Bacolod lights candles for ousted Sereno|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/regions/653118/diocese-of-bacolod-lights-candles-for-ousted-sereno/story/|work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs|GMA News]]}} Katipunan Ave, Quezon City,{{cite news|title=Bandila: Mga estudyante nagsagawa ng kilos protesta laban sa pagtalsik kay CJ Sereno|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aBZvqRiVvHI|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} and even displaying a makeshift coffin that, according to the protesters, symbolizes and mourns the "death of democracy" and the "death of judiciary."{{cite web|title=Bandila: Mga taga-suporta ni Sereno, tuloy ang protesta|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ffiKeWoLuCk|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} Among those who joined the rally were former CHR Chairperson [[Etta Rosales]] and Archdiocese of Manila Broderick Pabillo.{{cite news|title=TV Patrol: Mga supporters ni Sereno galit sa desisyon ng SC|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e9EoxMopupg|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} On May 12, church groups members announced that they will held the 10-day vigil in front of the Supreme Court.{{cite news|title=Church groups in 10-day vigil for 'democracy's death' for Sereno ouster|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/653134/church-groups-on-10-day-vigil-for-democracy-s-death-in-sereno-ouster/story/|work=GMA News}} === Shooting of Marcelito Paez, Mark Ventura and Richmond Nilo === On December 4, 2017, Marcelito Paez was killed by unidentified assailant while driving his [[Toyota Innova]] in Jaen-Zaragoza Road in [[Jaen, Nueva Ecija]]. Human rights Karapatan condemned the killing of Paez.{{cite news |title=Activist priest killed in Ecija gun attack |url=https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2017/12/05/1765786/activist-priest-killed-ecija-gun-attack|work=[[The Philippine Star]]}} Before his death, Paez helped for the release of the political prisoner Rommel Tucay, who was detained in Cagayan jail.{{cite news |title=Bishop blasts 'unjust and brutal' killing of elderly priest |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/12/05/17/bishop-blasts-unjust-and-brutal-killing-of-elderly-priest |accessdate=November 9, 2018 |work=ABS-CBN News}} On April 29, 2018, a 37-year-old priest Mark Ventura was shot dead by [[Snatch theft|riding-in-tandem]] assailants after taking a Sunday mass in [[Gattaran, Cagayan]]. Authorities said that Ventura blessed the children and talked to the choir members when the assailants shot him.{{cite news |title=Priest shot dead after Sunday Mass in Cagayan |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/201351-cagayan-priest-mark-ventura-shot-dead-sunday-mass |accessdate=November 9, 2018 |work=[[Rappler]]}} The CBCP, Senator [[Francis Pangilinan]] and Anakbayan condemned the murder of Ventura, with Anakbayan called it "fascistic, [[Tyrant|tyrannical]], and mafia-style rule" by the Duterte administration.{{cite news |title=CBCP condemns murder of Cagayan priest Mark Ventura |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/201370-cbcp-condemns-murder-cagayan-priest-mark-ventura |accessdate=November 9, 2018 |work=[[Rappler]]}} On May 1, Manila Archbishop [[Luis Antonio Tagle]] denounced the killing, saying in Tagalog, "Isn't he a gift from God? Is it that easy now to kill and throw a person away?"{{cite news |title=Cardinal Tagle hits murder of Cagayan's Fr Mark Ventura |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/201548-cardinal-tagle-murder-cagayan-priest-mark-ventura#cxrecs_s |accessdate=November 9, 2018 |work=[[Rappler]]}} On May 3, the Ventura's family and the [[Cagayan Valley]] police issued a P300,00 reward for the information of the suspect of the murder.{{cite news |title=Family of Fr Mark Ventura, PNP offer cash reward for info on his killers |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/201682-reward-money-offered-for-father-ventura-killers#cxrecs_s |accessdate=November 9, 2018 |work=[[Rappler]]}} On June 10, a priest, Richmond Nilo of the Diocese of Cabanatuan, was gunned down by unknown assailant as he was preparing for evening mass at a small chapel in [[Zaragoza, Nueva Ecija]] on June 10, 2018 at 6:05 pm.{{cite news |title=Priest shot dead in Nueva Ecija — CBCP |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/regions/656374/priest-shot-dead-in-nueva-ecija-cbcp/story/ |work=GMA News}}{{cite news |title=Another priest in Nueva Ecija gunned down |url=https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2018/06/11/1823641/another-priest-nueva-ecija-gunned-down |work=[[The Philippine Star]]}} Following the murder, the [[Philippine National Police]] said that they tagged at least five suspects in connection with the killing of Nilo. One of the suspects linked to the murder, Adell Roll Milan—an altar boy at the church, was arrested by the police on June 14.{{cite news |title=PNP nabs suspect in Fr. Richmond Nilo slay|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/1001118/pnp-nabs-suspect-in-fr-richmond-nilo-slay |work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]}} PNP chief Oscar Albayalde identified him a resident of Barangy Malapit, [[San Isidro, Nueva Ecija]].{{cite news |title=Suspect in Father Nilo's killing arrested – Nueva Ecija police |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/205007-pnp-nueva-ecija-arrests-suspect-richmond-nilo-killing |work=[[Rappler]]}} The police retrieved surveillance cameras; one showing the two men riding in the motorcycle in a road near the chapel moments before the crime, and another one showing a third suspect who served as lookout while two others were seen in a getaway vehicle.{{cite news |title=5 suspects tagged in Ecija priest's killing |url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/06/13/18/5-suspects-tagged-in-ecija-priests-killing |work=ABS-CBN News}} Another CCTV footage, timestamped 5:09 pm, shows Milan is seen riding his motorcycle outside T. Ador Dionisio National High School, roughly {{convert|25|km|miles}} from the church.{{cite news |title=CCTV footage shows arrested suspect in Fr Nilo slay far from crime scene |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/205514-cctv-footage-richmond-nilo-suspect-far-crime-scene |work=[[Rappler]]}} However, Elena Matias, grandmother of Milan, during the interview with Rappler, said that the police (wearing only civilian clothes) wrongly arrested him as they did not introduce themselves, and did not present any warrant of arrest.{{cite news |title=PNP got the wrong guy – grandma of accused in Fr Nilo murder |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/205496-pnp-wrong-guy-richmond-nilo-killing-adell-milan-grandmother |work=[[Rappler]]}} The distance between Milan's house and the small chapel is just at least 25 kilometers away. Matias also said that neither she nor her grandson had knowledge of the killing. Larry Gadon, Milan's lawyer, believes that he is a [[fall guy]]. Milan's childhood friend, Nelson John Oreo, claimed that he was with Milan 4:00 to 8:30 p.m. on the day when the priest was killed.{{cite news |title=Alleged gunman in Fr. Nilo slay 'a fall guy' —lawyer |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/657791/alleged-gunman-in-fr-nilo-slay-a-fall-guy-lawyer/story/ |work=GMA News}} Several members from religious sectors, such as CBCP, and opposition politicians, have directly pointed the finger at Duterte,{{cite news |title=CBCP condemns 'outrageously evil' murder of Fr Richmond Nilo |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/204665-cbcp-murder-nueva-ecija-priest-richmond-nilo |work=[[Rappler]]}}{{cite news |title='They are killing our flock. They are killing us shepherds.' |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/204692-archbishop-villegas-statement-killing-nueva-ecija-priest-richmond-nilo |accessdate=June 29, 2018 |work=[[Rappler]]}} who is known for his attacks against the church—whom are critical of the administration.{{cite news|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/nation/05/22/16/duterte-calls-catholic-church-most-hypocritical-institution |title=Duterte calls Catholic Church 'most hypocritical institution' |author=Punzalan, Jamaine |website=[[ABS-CBN Corporation]] |date=May 22, 2016 |accessdate=November 6, 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/787033/duterte-slams-church-as-hypocritical-institution |title=Duterte slams Church as hypocritical institution |website=Inquirer.net |date=May 23, 2016 |accessdate=November 6, 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2016/06/27/1597277/duterte-makes-fun-catholic-churchs-practices |title=Duterte makes fun of Catholic Church's practices |website=Philstar.com |date=June 27, 2016 |accessdate=November 6, 2016}} Another alleged perpetrator of Nilo's murder identified as Omar Mallari, who was arrested by the police on July 2. According to the police, they traced Mallari's whereabouts using the plate number of vehicle which was caught in a CCTV footage when Nilo was killed. Aside from Mallari, they also apprehended the suspect Manuel Torres, while two other suspects, Rolando Garcia and Marius Albis Torres, surrendered. However, some of the suspects remain at large. The police said that, in their affidavits, Mallari and Garcia said that they were paid by Torres a P100,000 to kill the priest.{{cite news |title=Cops arrest 'self-confessed' gunman in Nueva Ecija priest's slay |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/07/02/18/cops-arrest-self-confessed-gunman-in-nueva-ecija-priests-slay |work=ABS-CBN News}} On October 5, another suspect named Bernie Limpio, 36, was arrested during the nighttime buy-bust operation in [[Maddela, Quirino]]. During the investigation by the police, they found out that Limpio has an arrest warrant for the Nilo's case.{{cite news |title=Suspek sa pagpatay ng pari sa Nueva Ecija, arestado |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/10/06/18/suspek-sa-pagpatay-ng-pari-sa-nueva-ecija-arestado |work=ABS-CBN News}} === Apprehending of bystanders ("''Oplan Tambay''") === On mid-June, Duterte launched the campaign, called ''Oplan Tambay'', against the loiterers ({{lang-tl|tambays}}) who violated the city ordinance such as smoking in public places, drinking liquor on the streets, and going shirtless in public.{{cite news |title=The cost of loitering: Rundown of penalties for 'Oplan Tambay' |url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/focus/06/21/18/the-cost-of-loitering-rundown-of-penalties-for-oplan-tambay |work=ABS-CBN News}} The campaign had at least 8,000 residents were either accosted or apprehended for violating the rules in two weeks. However, this campaign was described by some sectors as another human rights violation being committed by the administration.{{cite web |title=Cheers, jeers greet drive vs 'tambay' in provinces|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/1004092/cheers-jeers-greet-drive-vs-tambay-in-provinces |work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]}} Randy David, sociology professor of University of the Philippines, said in an opinion statement that Duterte has "able to instill fear in people's minds even without declaring martial law by ordering the Philippine National Police to crack down on "tambays" or street loiterers".{{cite web |title=Mautak! Randy David: 'Oplan Tambay' allows Duterte to terrorize people without martial law |url=http://politics.com.ph/mautak-randy-david-oplan-tambay-allows-duterte-to-terrorize-people-without-martial-law/|work=Politiko}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20180628052603/http://politics.com.ph/mautak-randy-david-oplan-tambay-allows-duterte-to-terrorize-people-without-martial-law/ Archived] from the original. Conversely, Chief Insp. Mercy Villaro, spokesperson of the Mandaue City Police Office said the campaign against loiterers "would help address the problem of fraternities in the city."{{cite news |title=No More Tambays |url=http://cebudailynews.inquirer.net/180896/no-more-tambays |work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer|Cebu Daily News]]}} Gabriela party-list blamed Duterte for high volume of loiterers in the streets, citing the government's failure of ending the ENDO and wage increase.{{cite news |title=Pagdami ng tambay, dapat isisi kay Duterte: Gabriela |url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/video/news/06/22/18/pagdami-ng-tambay-dapat-isisi-kay-duterte-gabriela |work=ABS-CBN News}} On June 25, a netizen posted a photo of commuters holding a tarpaulin banner saying "''Hindi po kami tambay, nag-aabang lang ng jeep. At kung tambay man huwag kaming hulihin, saktan, patayin!''" ({{literal translation}} "We're not hanging out, just waiting for the jeep. And if we do not hang around, strike, kill!") while waiting for a jeepney ride.{{cite news |title=Look: Passengers hold banner saying 'Hindi po kami tambay' |url=https://news.mb.com.ph/2018/06/27/look-passengers-hold-banner-saying-hindi-po-kami-tambay/ |accessdate=June 30, 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180630123101/https://news.mb.com.ph/2018/06/27/look-passengers-hold-banner-saying-hindi-po-kami-tambay/ |archivedate=June 30, 2018|work=[[Manila Bulletin]]}} ==== Death of Genesis 'Tisoy' Argoncillo ==== A 25-year-old{{notetag|Some source says 22-year-old.{{cite news |title=Murder charges filed vs 2 inmates for the death of 'Tisoy' |url=https://newsinfo.inquirer.net/1003257/breaking-murder-charges-filed-vs-2-inmates-for-the-death-of-tisoy |work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]}}}} Genesis 'Tisoy' Argoncillo, who was arrested during an ''Oplan Tambay'' operation on June 15, was allegedly killed by fellow detainees inside the Novaliches Police Station on June 19 after serving 4-days in the detention.{{cite news |title=Genesis Argoncillo killed by fellow detainees – QC police |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/205509-qc-police-genesis-argoncillo-killed-by-fellow-detainees |work=[[Rappler]]}} According to Argoncillo's elder sister, Marilou Argoncillo, he was watching videos on his phone in front of a store next to their house in Novaliches, Quezon City when police officers arrested him for being a topless.{{cite news |title='Binaboy nila kapatid ko': Family seeks justice for man allegedly beaten to death in detention |url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/focus/06/20/18/binaboy-nila-kapatid-ko-family-seeks-justice-for-man-allegedly-beaten-to-death-in-detention |work=ABS-CBN News}} Supt. Carlito Grijaldo, commander of Quezon City Police Station 4, said Argoncillo's death was self-inflicted, claiming the detainee was "mentally disturbed". A death certificate shows that Argoncillo's "immediate cause" of his death was "multiple [[Blunt trauma|blunt force trauma]]" applied to his "head, neck, chest, and upper extremities."{{cite news |title=Exclusive: Photos, death certificate show Genesis 'Tisoy' Argoncillo beaten to death |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/205449-exclusive-arrested-tambay-genesis-argoncillo-death-certificate-photos |work=[[Rappler]]}} QCPD Director Chief Supt. Joselito Esquivel said that Argoncillo had no signs of external injuries when the autopsy conducted. The police earlier claimed that Argoncillo had died from shortness of breath.{{cite news |title=QC Police chief expects more suspects to be charged in Genesis Argoncillo's death |url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/06/22/Genesis-Argoncillo-tambay-Quezon-City-police-murder.html}} The police filed the charges against Justin Mercado and Richard Bautista—alleged Sputnik gang members. The two were held responsible for supposedly mauling Argoncillo. According to Esquivel, they have been relieved at least five police officers following the death of Argoncillo.{{cite news |title=5 QC cops relieved from posts over death of Genesis Argoncillo |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/657794/5-qc-cops-relieved-from-posts-over-death-of-genesis-argoncillo/story/ |work=GMA News}} === Killing of farmers === {{Main|2018 Sagay massacre}} There are alleged reports coming from the opposition groups, stating that the military are behind of the killing of the farmers.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PHNaTYWDFg4 "TV Patrol: Ilang magsasaka, nangalampag sa DAR"] (in Tagalog). ABS-CBN News. [[YouTube]] One coalition claimed that 80 farmers have been killed (October 2017 data) under the Duterte administration.{{cite news|title=Group claims more than 80 farmers have been killed under Duterte admin|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/630142/group-claims-more-than-80-farmers-have-been-killed-under-duterte-admin/story/?related|work=GMA News}} On October 20, 2018, an armed gunmen killed 9 farmers inside the [[sugarcane]] plantation in [[Sagay, Negros Occidental]].{{cite news |title=PNP eyes 4 groups in killing of 9 sugar farmers in Sagay |url=https://newsinfo.inquirer.net/1045819/pnp-eyes-4-groups-in-killing-of-9-sugar-farmers-in-sagay |accessdate=October 23, 2018 |work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]}} Initially, the police stated that the [[New People's Army]] may be "behind" of the massacre.{{cite news |title=NPA may be behind Negros Occidental attack — PNP |url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/10/22/pnp-negros-occidental-npa.html |accessdate=October 22, 2018 |work=[[CNN Philippines]]}} However, opposition groups, likewise, said that Duterte administration and the military "should be held responsible" for this,{{cite news |title=Lorenzana hits Bayan Muna chair Colmenares for linking military to Sagay massacre |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/672025/lorenzana-hits-bayan-muna-chair-colmenares-for-linking-military-to-sagay-massacre/story/ |accessdate=October 23, 2018 |work=GMA News}} and another group also pointed the finger to Duterte for the act.{{cite web |title=Palace condemns killing of 9 Negros sugar workers |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/671980/palace-condemns-killing-of-9-negros-sugar-workers/story/ |work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs|GMA News]] |accessdate=October 22, 2018}} == International ties with Duterte == === China-Duterte ties === The ties between President Duterte and China has been heavily condemned by the militant groups, particularly the [[territorial disputes in the South China Sea|territorial disputes]] in the [[South China Sea]].{{cite news |title=Pagdami ng Chinese workers, isa sa isyu sa Bonifacio Day |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wSfQwu4EBn0 |work=ABS-CBN News via Youtube}} ==== "Welcome to the Philippines, Province of China" tarpaulin ==== On July 12, 2018, a red tarpaulin read "WELCOME TO THE PHILIPPINES, PROVINCE OF CHINA" (with a [[Chinese language|Chinese]] translation below the text) has been installed on several footbridges in Metro Manila, coinciding the two-year anniversary of [[Philippines v. China|winning the Philippines on its arbitration case against China]].{{cite news |title=Banners welcome visitors to 'Philippines, province of China'|url=https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2018/07/12/1832876/banners-welcome-visitors-philippines-province-china |work=[[The Philippine Star]]}} It is possible that the tarpaulin are the reference to a "joke" made by Duterte that "the country can be a province of the Asian giant," five months earlier.{{cite news |title=Duterte jokes about 'Philippines, province of China' |url=https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2018/02/19/1789428/duterte-jokes-about-philippines-province-china |work=[[The Philippine Star]]}} Chinese Ambassador Zhao Jianhua slammed the banners, calling it "a "vicious attack" on the "independent foreign policy" pursued by Duterte.{{cite news |title=PH a province of China? 'Not now, not ever,' envoy says |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/207543-ambassador-zhao-jianhua-statement-province-china-tarpaulins |work=[[Rappler]]}} Zhao also said that the Philippines "can never be any part of China."{{cite news |title=Chinese envoy: PH will never be a part of China |url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/07/17/Philippines-Province-of-China-banner.html |work=[[CNN Philippines]]}} The Philippine National Police were investigating the person behind this installed tarpaulin,{{cite news |title='Enemies of gov't' behind 'Philippines, Province of China' banners? Police investigate |url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/07/12/Philippines-Province-of-China-banners-Metro-Manila.html |work=[[CNN Philippines]]}} however, the person were never known. Presidential Spokesperson Harry Roque said that the banners were "absurd" and the "enemies" of the government. Opposition lawmakers Bayan Muna Rep. Carlos Zarate and ACT Teachers Rep. Antonio Tinio denied that leftist groups were behind of the tarpaulins. ==== State visit of Chinese President Xi Jinping ==== The state visit of [[President of the People's Republic of China|Chinese President]] [[Xi Jinping]] on November 19–21, 2018 was being protested by the militant groups, who called him to "go away" in [[Mandarin Chinese|Mandarin]].(from 0:06) '''Protesters:''' Mr. Xi Jinping, Zǒu kāi. / '''Reporter:'''...Mandarin ang "Zǒu kāi" (走開), ibig sabihin, "lumayas ka".
(from 0:26) '''Neri Colmenares''': Kino-consumate ng ... ang pagbenta ng ating soberanya. Yan talaga [ang] essential ng pagdalaw [ni Xi] dito. / '''Reporter:''' Giit ng mga rallyista, di dapat ipagbunyi ang pagdating ni Xi dahil pinapakita ni Pangulong Duterte ang napakalaking pagta-traidor umano niya sa bansa; naglalakihang pautang kapalit ng pagsuko sa [[South China Sea|West Philippine Sea]].
{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pBJfIow_SPY|title=TV Patrol: Pagdating ni Xi Jinping sinalubong ng protesta|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]] – via [[YouTube]]}} The reason why they protested is because the Philippines "sold" the territories to China. Meanwhile, the hotel in [[Taguig]] where Xi will be stay there was being surrounded by the police and secured its perimeter, therefore, the protesters failed to reached the area. === US-Duterte ties === Despite in fact that the [[Federal government of the United States|US government]] fiercely condemns Duterte's war on drugs,See the following citations:
{{bulleted list|[http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/12/24/16/dutertes-drug-war-a-campaign-of-mass-atrocities-us-senators "Duterte's drug war a 'campaign of mass atrocities': US senators"].|[http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2016/12/28/1657489/us-senators-want-tracking-funds-philippines-amid-drug-war "US senators want tracking of funds in Philippines amid drug war"].}} most of the militant groups – particularly the left-wing side – have also added the United States, alongside with Duterte, in their protests due to "[[imperialism]],"(from 0:24) Damay din ang pati watawat ng Amerika, dahil imperyalista rin daw sila.
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GM92sKqAYr0 Bandila: Ilang estudyante, nagsunog ng watawat ng China sa pagtatapos ng bisita ni Xi Jinping] with even creating the effigy of President Trump.{{cite news |title=Motorists told: Avoid Asean dry run routes |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171009084110/http://globalnation.inquirer.net/160721/philippine-news-updates-global-nation-association-of-southeast-asian-nations |work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]}} Archived from the [http://globalnation.inquirer.net/160721/philippine-news-updates-global-nation-association-of-southeast-asian-nations original]. == "Red October" plot == The so-called "Red October" plot is the alleged rumor of ousting President Duterte from the office.{{cite news |title=Linking critics to Red October destab plot a Martial Law tactic —Robredo |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/668964/linking-critics-to-red-october-destab-plot-a-martial-law-tactic-robredo/story/ |accessdate=September 27, 2018 |work=GMA News}} The alleged plot was announced by the [[Armed Forces of the Philippines]] (AFP) on September 24, who said that the [[Communist Party of the Philippines]] (CPP), opposition parties such as [[Liberal Party (Philippines)|Liberal Party]] (LP) and Tindig Pilipinas were behind the planning of the ouster plot. One of the opposition being mentioned about the involvement is ousted Chief Justice Maria Lourdes Sereno,{{cite news |title=Duterte faces 'Red October' ouster plot - military officials |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/09/24/18/duterte-faces-red-october-ouster-plot-military-officials |work=ABS-CBN News}} who subsequently denied the ousting or removal of the President. Robredo made a statement on September 25, saying that linking the opposition to the plot is a tactic used in the Martial Law and the claim was baseless. She and Senator Antonio Trillanes denied the plot involvement.{{cite news |title=Communists raise martial law fears over 'fictional' oust-Duterte plot |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/09/25/18/communists-raise-martial-law-fears-over-fictional-oust-duterte-plot |work=ABS-CBN News}} The Philippine National Police doubted about the plot.{{cite news |title=PNP unsure of 'Red October' oust Duterte plot |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/668866/pnp-unsure-of-red-october-oust-duterte-plot/story/ |accessdate=September 27, 2018 |work=GMA News}} The Makabayan bloc denied the involvement in the plot, though they admit that they will held a massive rally the next month.{{cite news |title=Makabayan solons deny ‘Red October’ destab plot |url=https://untvweb.com/news/makabayan-solons-deny-red-october-destab-plot/ |accessdate=September 27, 2018 |work=UNTV News}} Department of Labor and Employment Secretary Silvestre Bello III said that the plot is just hearsay and he added that ousting the President is impossible as Duterte is being given a strong support by the people.{{cite news |title=‘Red October’ is just hearsay; no one can oust a popular president – Bello |url=https://untvweb.com/news/red-october-is-just-hearsay-no-one-can-oust-a-popular-president-bello/ |accessdate=September 27, 2018 |work=UNTV News}} On September 25, the NBI and Philippine Army raided the farm house in [[Teresa, Rizal]] where they arrested a Chinese national Lily Ong and confiscated the high-calibre guns. According to the NBI spokesperson Ferdinand Lavin, they still have no evidence proving that Ong and the confiscated guns are connected to the [[New People's Army]] (NPA), as well as the "Red October" plot. However, AFP spokesperson Brigadier General Edgard Arevalo said that Ong is connected to the rebel groups and she used the farm house as a hideout for NPA members.{{cite news |title='Kaugnayan sa NPA' ng naarestong Chinese, pinasisilip |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/news/09/27/18/kaugnayan-sa-npa-ng-naarestong-chinese-pinasisilip |accessdate=September 27, 2018 |work=ABS-CBN News}} [[File:Press conference of student activists from NCR and Bulacan schools denouncing AFP terror tag.jpg|thumb|300px|Student leaders from NCR and Bulacan schools denouncing AFP terror tag.]] On October 4, the AFP bared that the CPP is allegedly brainwashed the various universities and colleges in Metro Manila to participate against the government through showing the film of darkest years during the Martial Law era. The AFP also had a list of schools which were allegedly involved the plot:{{cite news |title=AFP bares universities linked to alleged 'Red October' plot |url=https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2018/10/04/1857187/afp-bares-universities-linked-alleged-red-october-plot |accessdate=October 5, 2018 |work=[[The Philippine Star]]}} {{hidden |List of universities |*University of the Philippines in Diliman and Manila *[[Polytechnic University of the Philippines]] *[[Ateneo de Manila University]] *[[De La Salle University]] *[[University of Santo Tomas]] *[[Adamson University]] *[[Far Eastern University]] *University of the East in Recto and Caloocan *Emilio Aguinaldo College *Eulogio “Amang” Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology *[[San Beda University]] *[[Lyceum of the Philippines University]] *[[University of Makati]] (UMak) *[[University of Caloocan City]] *University of Manila and Philippine Normal University |headerstyle=background:#ccccff |style=text-align:center; }} Aside from the list, the AFP also named the school "Caloocan City College", which does not exist on [[Commission on Higher Education (Philippines)|Commission on Higher Education]]'s (CHED) record.{{cite news |title=Universities deny alleged 'Red October' involvement |url=https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2018/10/03/1857034/universities-deny-alleged-red-october-involvement |work=[[The Philippine Star]]}} Shortly after the list has shown, representatives from some above-mentioned lists slammed AFP for being included in their plot, with some calling it "baseless and dangerous".{{cite news |title=Schools slam military for linking them to Red October plot |url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/213521-school-officials-students-slam-afp-red-october-plot-accusation |work=[[Rappler]]}} The CPP also made a statement, slamming Duterte and the AFP for blaming the communist group in order to justify the plot, and also said that they "would ultimately bring down Duterte administration" not the so-called plot.{{cite news |title=CPP: People would bring down Duterte not ‘Red October’ |url=http://davaotoday.com/main/politics/cpp-people-would-bring-down-duterte-not-red-october/ |accessdate=October 5, 2018 |work=Davao Today |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181005033655/http://davaotoday.com/main/politics/cpp-people-would-bring-down-duterte-not-red-october/ |archivedate=October 5, 2018}} == Timeline == {{Main|Timeline of protests against Rodrigo Duterte}} == Accolades == {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! Recipient ! Category ! Year ! {{abbr|Ref.|Reference(s)}} |- ! scope="row"| [[Shibby de Guzman]] ! scope="row"| 30 Most Influential Teens ([[Time (magazine)|''Time'']]) ! scope="row"| 2017 | {{cite news|title=The 30 Most Influential Teens of 2017|url=http://time.com/5003930/most-influential-teens-2017/|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]}} |- ! scope="row"| [[Babae Ako movement|#BabaeAko movement]] ! scope="row"| 25 Most Influential People on the Internet ([[Time (magazine)|''Time'']]) ! scope="row"| 2018 | {{cite news |title=Bandila: Mga nasa likod ng #BabaeAko movement, kinilala ng Time Magazine |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OHCrPsGBVyk|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs|ABS-CBN News]]|language=Tagalog|via=[[YouTube]]}} |} == See also == {{portal|2010s|Philippines}} * [[People Power Revolution]] * [[Second EDSA Revolution|EDSA II]] * [[EDSA III]] * [[2015 Iglesia ni Cristo protests|2015 INC Protests]] * [[Burial of Ferdinand Marcos]] * [[Million People March]] * [[Protests against Donald Trump]] {{small|([[Timeline of protests against Donald Trump|timeline]])}} * [[Protests against Emmanuel Macron]] * [[2017 Venezuelan protests]] {{small|([[Timeline of the 2017 Venezuelan protests|timeline]])}} * [[2013–2018 Nicaraguan protests]] * [[Euromaidan]] * [[2017–2018 Russian protests]] == Notes == {{Commons category}} {{NoteFoot}} == References == {{reflist|30em}} {{Rodrigo Duterte}} {{Philippine Drug War}} {{Anti-government protests in the 21st century}} {{Ongoing protests}} [[Category:2016 in the Philippines]] [[Category:2017 in the Philippines]] [[Category:2018 in the Philippines]] [[Category:Internet-based activism]] [[Category:Ongoing protests]] [[Category:Philippine Drug War]] [[Category:Presidency of Rodrigo Duterte]] [[Category:Protests in the Philippines]] [[Category:Political repression in the Philippines]] [[Category:Student protests]] [[Category:Political history of the Philippines]] [[Category:History of the Philippines (1986–present)]] [[Category:2016 protests]] [[Category:2017 protests]] [[Category:2018 protests]]

{{Infobox person | name = Robert Stadlober | image = Robert Stadlober Berlinale 2008.jpg | image_size = frameless | alt = Robert Stadlober, German actor Volkswagen People’s Night 2008 | caption = Robert Stadlober at the [[58th Berlin International Film Festival]] (2008) | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1982|08|03|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Friesach]], [[Carinthia (state)|Carinthia]], Austria | occupation = [[Actor]], [[voiceover artist]], [[musician]], and [[singer]] | years_active = 1995–present | spouse = | partner = <!-- unmarried life partner; use| ''Name (1950–present)| '' --> | children = | parents = | relatives = Anja Stadlober (sister) | awards = | website = <!-- {{URL|Example.com}} --> }} '''Robert Stadlober''' (born 3 August 1982) is an [[Austria]]n actor and musician. His sister is [[Anja Stadlober]], also an actress.
==Life and career== Robert Stadlober was born on 3 August 1982 in [[Friesach]] in the [[Austria]]n province of [[Carinthia (state)|Carinthia]], and grew up in Puchfeld in the [[Steiermark]] (Austria) and in [[Berlin]] (Germany). As a child he worked as a [[voiceover artist]] for several films and he acted in different TV productions and motion picture films also. His largest success is playing the main role as Benjamin Lebert, a partially disabled [[teenager]] at a boarding school, in the film ''[[Crazy (2000 film)|Crazy]]'' (2000). Later, he starred in ''[[Summer Storm (2004 film)|Summer Storm]]'' (2004), a [[gay]] coming-of-age story set at a rowing summer-camp. Although [[The Advocate (LGBT magazine)|The Advocate]] has claimed that he is [[bisexual]],<ref name="advocate">{{citation |title=Boys of Summer |periodical=[[The Advocate (LGBT magazine)|The Advocate]] |date=2005-09-13 |first=Mike |last=Goodridge |accessdate=2007-09-22}}</ref> Stadtlober himself objects to such labelling, saying that he's just had some homosexual experiences and that this is normal.<ref>Interview to [[Marco Kreuzpaintner]], who cites some German interviews to Stadlober: ''Summer Storm'' English DVD, [[Peccadillo Pictures]], 2005.</ref>
He was awarded the "best young actor" award at the [[Montreal International Film Festival]] in 2004 for his portrayal in ''Summer Storm''.
He is also a singer and musician. He used to be in the rock Band [[Gary (band)|Gary]] with [[David Winter (actor)|David Winter]] and [[Rasmus Engler]] where he was the lead singer and played the guitar. He is now a third of Indie band Escorial Gruen.
Further, since 2007 he also runs the independent record label Siluh records.
Until 2007, he made three movies together with [[Tom Schilling]]: ''[[Crazy (2000 film)|Crazy]]'' (2000), ''Play It Loud!'' ({{lang-de|Verschwende Deine Jugend}}, 2003) and ''[[Black Sheep (2006 German film)|Black Sheep]]'' ({{lang-de|Schwarze Schafe}}, 2006).
Robert Stadlober currently lives in [[Berlin]] (2008).

{{see also|Scholarships of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill}} {{coord|36.00187|-78.92239|display=title}}
The '''Robertson Scholars Leadership Program''' is a joint merit scholarship and leadership development program at [[Duke University]] and the [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill]]. The scholarship offers participants a unique "dual citizenship" at both Duke University and UNC-Chapel Hill. Approximately 36 students are selected from among the more than 60,000 applications to the two schools each year.<ref>[http://www.unc.edu/news/archives/apr07/robertsonscholars041007.html UNC, Duke announce winners of Robertson Scholarships]. UNC-Chapel Hill News Services.</ref>
==History and background== The program was created in 2000 by benefactor [[Julian Robertson]], a 1955 graduate of UNC-Chapel Hill. Mr. Robertson sought to encourage collaboration between Duke and the University of North Carolina and to promote the development of young leaders.<ref>[http://robertsonscholars.org/about-us/our-benefactors/ Our Benefactors] Robertson Scholars Leadership Program</ref> His initial $24 million gift as well as his subsequent gifts to the program and the universities are overseen by a Board of Directors including Duke University President [[Richard Brodhead]], UNC-Chapel Hill Chancellor [[Carol Folt]], and Julian Robertson himself.<ref>[http://robertsonscholars.org/about-us/governance/ Governance] Robertson Scholars Leadership Program.</ref>
The program covers four years of undergraduate tuition, mandatory fees, room and board, and provides recipients full funding for three summer experiences.<ref>[http://robertsonscholars.org/program/opportunities-benefits/ Opportunities and Benefits] Robertson Scholars Leadership Program.</ref> The summer components of the program have served as a model for DukeEngage, an initiative to offer the opportunity for summer research and internships to all Duke undergraduates.<ref name="nytimes.com">[https://www.nytimes.com/2007/02/13/education/13service.html Duke Program Seeks to Expand Service Work]. The New York Times.</ref><ref>[http://www.insidehighered.com/news/2007/02/13/duke New Support for Community Service]. Inside Higher Education.</ref>
Robertson Scholars are required to spend the second semester of their sophomore year at the sister campus and may attend classes at the sister campus throughout their undergraduate career.
Participants have regularly won [[Truman Scholarship]]s and [[Fulbright Fellowship]]s. (2005).<ref name="nytimes.com"/><ref>Peterson's smart choices: honors programs & colleges. Princeton, N.J.: Peterson's.</ref><ref>[http://www.dukenews.duke.edu/2007/03/truman07.html Duke junior named Truman Scholar]. Duke University Office of News & Communications.</ref><ref>[http://www.unc.edu/news/archives/mar05/truman032905.html UNC’s Lauren McAlee wins $30,000 Truman Scholarship]. UNC News Services.</ref><ref>[http://www.robertsonscholars.org/index.php?type=dynamic&source=newsDetail&id=942 Robertson Scholar E. Mary Williams wins Truman Scholarship]. Robertson Scholars Program.</ref><ref>[http://www.truman.gov/scholar_listing/scholar_listing_list_more.htm?year=2007 2007 Truman Scholars]. The Harry S. Truman Scholarship Foundation.</ref><ref>[http://media.www.dukechronicle.com/media/storage/paper884/news/2008/02/05/Features/The-Power.Of.One-3188681.shtml The Power of One]. The Duke Chronicle.</ref><ref>[http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=MCNP&p_multi=RHDB&p_theme=mcnp&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=119BAF7D372EBD50&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM Rutland graduation speaker is just 21]. Rutland Herald.</ref>
==Program timeline==
===Orientation retreat=== Shortly before the start of first-year fall semester, incoming Scholars participate in a leadership retreat facilitated by instructors from the [[National Outdoor Leadership School]] (NOLS) at the Nantahala Outdoor Center in [[Bryson City, North Carolina]].
===First-year dinner series=== First-year Scholars develop practical life skills and discuss a wide range of subjects with guest speakers. Topics have included public speaking, presentation skills, personal finances, etiquette, and networking.
===Colloquium=== Colloquium is a one-semester course taken during the Scholar's first year. It provides a forum to discuss issues impacting society at large and ethical challenges facing today's leaders. This course offers Scholars a chance to develop an ethical framework for leading and provides a unique, Robertson-only space to strengthen intellectual ties among the class.
===Campus Switch=== During the second semester of their sophomore year, Robertson Scholars live and take classes on their sister campus. The Campus Switch is designed to build stronger educational and community ties between UNC-Chapel Hill and Duke, and to offer Scholars the opportunity to adjust to new situations and thrive in challenging environments.
===Senior Capstone=== The Robertson Senior Capstone Experience is designed to support senior scholars in their transition from college to the next stage of their careers. The Capstone includes a winter retreat and a dinner series that combines reflection on their four-year experience with conversations with Robertson alumni and other young leaders.
==Summer experiences==
===Community Summer=== Scholars spend the summer after their first year living together and participating in community service internships in the United States. Past locations have included [[Cleveland, Mississippi]], [[New Orleans, Louisiana]], and [[Whitesburg, Kentucky]]. This summer is designed to strengthen scholars' relationships with each other and to increase awareness of the social and economic challenges of various geographic regions in the US.
===Exploration Summer=== Scholars spend the summer after sophomore year exploring their academic or cultural interests, either domestically or internationally. Scholars can participate in a university-sponsored program, or they can propose a self-designed project to pursue individually or with other students.
===Launch Summer=== Scholars spend the summer after junior year engaged in an independent, self-designed project intended to focus their interests and launch them into life after college. Projects have included research for honors theses, pre-professional internships, and expansions of work undertaken in previous Robertson summers.
== References == {{reflist|2}}
== External links == * [http://www.robertsonscholars.org/ Robertson Scholars Leadership Program] * [http://www.robertsonfoundation.org/ Robertson Foundation]
{{University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill}} {{Duke University}}

{{refimprove|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox university | name = St Joseph's Teachers College | native_name = | image_name = | image_size = | image_alt = | caption = | latin_name = | motto = | motto_lang = | mottoeng = | established = 1897 | closed = | type = | affiliation = | endowment = | budget = | officer_in_charge = | chairman = | chancellor = | president = | vice-president = | superintendent = | provost = | vice_chancellor = | rector = | principal = | dean = | director = | head_label = | head = | academic_staff = | administrative_staff = | students = | undergrad = | postgrad = | doctoral = | other = | city = | state = | province = | country = | coor = {{coord|17.9969|-76.7839|display=inline,title}} | campus = | former_names = | free_label = | free = | colors = | colours = | athletics = | sports = | nickname = | mascot = | affiliations = | website = | logo = | footnotes = }} {{Location map | Jamaica | width = | float = | border = | caption = St. Joseph's Teachers' College | alt = | relief = | AlternativeMap = | label = | label_size = | position = | background = | mark = | marksize = | link = | lat_deg = 17.9969 | lon_deg = -76.7839 }} '''St. Joseph's Teachers' College''' is a [[Roman Catholic]] teacher training college in [[Kingston, Jamaica]]. It was founded in 1897 by the [[Franciscan]] [[Franciscan Sisters of Allegany|Sisters of Allegany]] a religious order for women in the [[Roman Catholicism in Jamaica|Roman Catholic Church in Jamaica]].
Over the years, the institution has undergone development and expansion both physically and in its academic programmes.<ref name="Digicel Jamaica Foundation">{{cite news|title=Digicel Foundation expands the Enrichment Centre Initiative at St. Joseph’s Teachers’ College|url=http://www.digiceljamaicafoundation.org/en/news/digicel-foundation-expands-the-enrichment-centre-initiative-at-st.-josephs-teachers-college|accessdate=August 23, 2011|date=September 28, 2010}}</ref>
==Diploma programmes== The College is a member of the Joint Board of Teacher Education (part of the [[University of the West Indies]], Mona, Jamaica) and offers two Joint Board Programmes: *Bachelor's degree in Teaching (Early Childhood & Primary) *Diploma in Teaching (Primary& Early Childhood)
The College also offers a bachelor's degree Programme in School Leadership & Management for Principals, Vice Principals, Senior Teachers and Trained teachers.
A B.Ed. in Primary Education is also,offered part-time over a five-years period in collaboration with [[Mount Saint Vincent University]], Halifax, Nova Scotia.<ref name=msvu />
This institution also consists of Dormitories where students from far parish can board.
Similarly, a Master of Education (M. Ed) in Primary Education is offered part-time over two years in collaboration with [[Mount Saint Vincent University]], Halifax, Nova Scotia.<ref name=msvu>{{cite news|title=Jamaica: Bachelor of Education Program|url=http://www.msvu.ca/en/home/programsdepartments/education/internationalprograms/bedinassociationwithstjosephsteacherscollege.aspx|accessdate=August 23, 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110809113606/http://www.msvu.ca/en/home/programsdepartments/education/internationalprograms/bedinassociationwithstjosephsteacherscollege.aspx|archivedate=August 9, 2011|df=}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://sjtc-ja.com/ St. Joseph's Teachers College ]

{{multiple issues| {{Unreferenced|date=May 2011}} {{Notability|bio|date=May 2011}} }} {{Use Indian English|date=December 2015}} [[File:Prof._Satish_Bahadur.jpg|thumb|Prof. Satish Bahadur]]
'''Satish Bahadur''' (26 November 1925 - 23 July 2010), was an [[India]]n film critic who served as Professor of Film Appreciation (1963–83) at the [[Film and Television Institute of India]], Pune, India, and a close associate of [[Marie Seton]], [[Vijaya Mulay]] and [[PK Nair]].
Until his death in [[Pune]], Satish continued to be actively involved with film appreciation and teaching of cinema. According to the obituary in [http://www.indianexpress.com/news/satish-bahadur-founder-of-film-appreciation/651362/ The Indian Express], he was "...one of the founding teachers of the FTII, he played a crucial role in shaping the policies and vision of the Institute. Even today, he is held in high esteem by his students, some of whom are luminaries of the Indian cinema. Arun Khopkar, filmmaker and student of Bahadur, was quoted as saying, '"...from day one, he became the guiding light in my life. Like a music teacher who explains the intricacies of taal and laya to his students, he would unveil countless aspects of films for us. Unlike many teachers who overshadow their students, he had the knack to bring the best out of his students. In fact, he was the one who started the concept of film diary amongst FTII students. I have this habit of calling the old, good and late faculty of the institute, the ghost faculty. Now, he belongs to that and sitting up there, he will continue to guide his students".
==Early life and education== Born in [[Moradabad]], he studied at the [[University of Agra]] and the [[Allahabad University]] in the state of [[Uttar Pradesh]]. He was married to Vinodini Bahadur (1928-2016). The couple had a daughter Nandini and a son Apurva (named for the protagonist of [[Apur Sansar]]).
==Career==
===1951-1963=== Taught Economics to postgraduate students at [[DAV College, Kanpur]] and University Institute of Social Sciences, Agra.
===1958-1963=== Promotional work in the emerging film society movement in India. Organized Agra Film Society for citizens, and Agra University Film Society for the campus. Founder member of the [https://web.archive.org/web/20110703091431/http://www.ffsi.org.in/ Federation of the Film Societies in India]. Editorial committee of [https://web.archive.org/web/20110201170932/http://www.ffsi.org.in/next.htm Indian Film Culture]. Research work on Indian components of the International Sociological Association project on Study of the Film Hero in seventeen different cultures.
===1963-1983=== Professor of Film Appreciation, Film and TV Institute of India, Pune.
===1968-2003=== Worked with the one-month-long summer extension program in Film Appreciation at Pune. The summer course, 2006 was the 31st in this series.
===1968-2002=== Taught numerous short duration courses in Film Appreciation (ranging from three days to ten days) at various cultural and educational organizations in India and also in Bangladesh..
==Publications==
1967-2003:
Numerous papers on different aspects of the film studies. Of special value are the following: *Some aspects of Phalke (Phalke Centenary Volume 1971). *Screen Education at university levels in India (European Center of Education, 1966) *Aesthetics: from traditional iconography to contemporary kitsch in the Indian Cinema Superbazar. Edited by Aruna Vasudev and Philip Langlet (1980). *Aesthetic Ideas and the film medium in Sandhan 2003, due to be included in the forthcoming Aesthetic Theories in Indian Tradition (Edited by D.P. Chattopadhaya, [[Kapila Vatsyayan]] and S.S. Deshpande).
He worked on several film and television programs explaining the basic concepts of Film Appreciation. Of special interest are the following: *Batein Filmo Ki: Hindi, 14 parts serial for Doordarshan (1983–1984). *Understanding Cinema: English, 6 hours 30 minutes, serial in 15 parts for the Consortium for Educational Communications (1985–1986). *Samajh Cinema Ki: Hindi, 5 hour serial in 12 parts for the Consortium of Educational Communications (1986–1987).
During 2006, the Asian Film Foundation, Mumbai presented the Satyajit Ray Memorial Award to Satish Bahadur for "Promoting Film as Art."
{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2011}}
{{authority control}}

{{Infobox university |name = Sichuan Agricultural University |native_name = {{lang|zh-Hans-CN|四川农业大学}} |image_name = Logo_of_Sichuan_Agricultural_University.png |image_size = 180px |image_alt = |caption = |latin_name = |motto = |mottoeng = |established = 1906 |closed = |type = Plant 111, Plant 2011 |affiliation = |endowment = |officer_in_charge = |chairman = Youliang Zheng |chancellor = |president = |vice-president = |superintendent = |provost = |vice_chancellor = |rector = |principal = |dean = |director = |head_label = |head = |faculty = |staff = |undergrad = |postgrad = |doctoral = |other = |city = [[Ya'an]] |state = |province = [[Sichuan]] |country = [[China]] |coor = |campus = Ya'an Campus, Chengdu Campus, Dujiangya Campus |former_names = |free_label = |free = |sports = |colors = |students = 40 thousand |nickname = |mascot = |athletics = |affiliations = [[Double First Class University Plan|Double First Class University]], [[Project 211|211 Project]] |website = http://english.sicau.edu.cn/ |logo = |footnotes = }}
'''Sichuan Agricultural University''' (SAU) is a university located in [[Ya'an]] city, [[Sichuan]] province, [[China]], and part of the “[[Project 211]]”, specialized in [[biotechnology]] and [[agricultural sciences]], as well as offering degrees in physical science, engineering, economics, management, veterinary medicine, liberal arts, pedagogy and law. It is a Chinese Ministry of Education [[Double First Class University Plan|Double First Class Discipline University]], with Double First Class status in certain disciplines.<ref name="Chinese Department of Education">{{Cite web |url=http://www.moe.gov.cn/srcsite/A22/moe_843/201709/t20170921_314942.html |title=教育部 财政部 国家发展改革委 关于公布世界一流大学和一流学科建设高校及建设 学科名单的通知 (Notice from the Ministry of Education and other national governmental departments announcing the list of double first class universities and disciplines)}}</ref>
==History== The institution was founded in 1906 as Sichuan Tong Sheng Agricultural School. It is the first public agricultural college in Sichuan Province. In 1935, it became a component of '''National Sichuan University'''. In 1956 it moved from [[Chengdu]] to Ya'an, where '''Sichuan Agricultural College''' was founded as an independent institution in 1956. In 1985 it was renamed as Sichuan Agricultural University.
Nowadays, Sichuan Agricultural University (SICAU) has three campuses, respectively located in Chengdu city, Ya'an city, and Dujiangyan city. SICAU belongs to the '''211 State Key University Group''' in China. The group member universities was officially selected by Chinese Central Government for priority funding as these universities were evaluated to rank in the top 100 in China for their distinguished achievements in research and education.
==Basic Profile== [[File:Sichuan Agricultural University 2.jpg|thumb|left|The building is one of the main research building of SAU in Chengdu Campus.]]
===Campuses=== With a total area of 4,500 mu (300 ha.) and an educational population of about 40,000, SAU consists of three branches, i.e. the base campus in Ya’an city, the Dujiangyan campus in Dujiangyan city and the Wenjiang campus in Chengdu.<ref name="Official web">{{cite web|title=Brief Introduction of Sichuan Agricultural University|url=http://english.sicau.edu.cn/?p=1&mdtp=2|website=Official website of SAU (EN)|publisher=Sichuan Agricultural University}}</ref>
Ya'an Campus is the main campus of Sichuan Agricultural University, which covers an area equivalent to almost a quarter of the downtown of [[Ya'an]] City. Most colleges, undergraduate and graduate programs are organized here.
Dujiangyan Campus(Sichuan Forestry College for the original) mainly include some generally and specialist undergraduate education.
Chengdu Campus located in Wenjiang District, Chengdu, Sichuan, which covers an area of 600 acres.
===Scientific Research Strength=== The university governs 18 colleges, 10 research institutes and centers. The university possesses 7 stations for post-doctoral research, 40 disciplines with the power to award doctoral degrees, 86 specialized disciplines for masters and 74 for undergraduates. At present, SICAU has 760 senior tutors for doctorate and master students. Among the 760 are 2 academicians of the Chinese Academy of Engineering, 5 national outstanding senior experts, one awardee of the “National Scientific Fund for Outstanding Young Fellows”, 7 national middle-aged and young experts awarded for their outstanding contribution to the country, 9 academic candidates of the national “Bai-Qian-Wan Talents Project” (100-1000-10,000 Talents Project) and one renowned teacher at the state level.<ref name="Official web" />
===Colleges=== *;Ya'an Campus ** College of Science ** College of Life Science ** College of Mechanical and Electrical Engineering ** College of Food Science ** College of Information Engineering ** College of Water Conservancy and Hydropower Engineering ** College of Marxism ** College of Literature and Law ** College of Arts and Sports ** College of Distance and Continuing Education *;Dujiangyan Campus ** College of Architecture and Urban-Rural Planning ** College of Civil Engineering ** College of Tourism ** Business School *;Chengdu Campus ** College of Agronomy ** College of Animal Science and Technology ** College of Veterinary Medicine ** College of Forestry ** College of Horticulture ** College of Resources ** College of Marxism ** College of Environmental Sciences ** College of Economics ** College of Landscape Architecture ** Rice Research Institute ** Triticeae Research Institute ** Maize Research Institute ** Animal Nutrition Institute
== References == {{Reflist}}

{{use American English|date=May 2016}} {{use mdy dates|date=May 2016}} '''Stay with It''' is a campaign in the United States intended to encourage and motivate [[engineering]] students to stay with the field of study and graduate with an [[engineer's degree]].
It is a collaboration between the [[President's Council on Jobs and Competitiveness]], the private sector and academia.<ref name="jobs-council"> {{cite web |title=Roadmap to Renewal: 2011 Year-End Report |url=http://files.jobs-council.com/files/2012/01/JobsCouncil_2011YearEndReportWeb.pdf |publisher=President's Council on Jobs and Competitiveness, p. 20}} </ref><ref name="asee-01"> {{cite web |title=Engineering: Stay with It |url=http://www.asee.org/retention-project/engineering-stay-with-it |publisher=American Society for Engineering Education }}</ref><ref name="wh-01">{{cite web |title=NASA Joins Campaign to Encourage the Next Generation of Engineers and Innovators |url=http://www.whitehouse.gov/blog/2012/03/19/nasa-joins-campaign-encourage-next-generation-american-engineers-and-innovators |publisher=White House Blog }}</ref><ref name="abc-01"> http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local&id=8581709 </ref>
It officially launched on March 14, 2012, with a Day of Engineering at the [[Georgia Institute of Technology]], and made available to a nationwide audience through a webcast on [[Facebook features#Facebook Live|Facebook Live]].<ref name="gatech-01">http://coe.gatech.edu/content/stay-it-day-engineering</ref><ref>http://www.nasa.gov/home/hqnews/2012/mar/HQ_12_043_Bolden_Facebook_Pres_Jobs.html</ref><ref>http://www.csus.edu/sacstatenews/Articles/2012/03/StayWithItMatsui03-14-12.html</ref> The webcast opened with a message from President [[Barack Obama]].
Major General [[Charles F. Bolden, Jr.]], [[Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration]], noted the occasion, saying that his message to students is simple: "Stay With It! Stay with your studies. Stay with your research. Stay with your dreams as you prepare to take your rightful place as the next great generation of American engineers, innovators and leaders."<ref name="wh-01" />
Congresswoman Doris Matsui addressed students after watching [[Only Won]] perform "I Wanna Be an Engineer" at the Sacramento State Stay With It event. "We need you, the country needs you – and engineering is not boring, it's fun. Engineers dream up, invent and build technologies that change the world. We will continue to lead, but a lot depends on the people who are studying engineering. … I encourage you to Stay with it – and dream!"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.csus.edu/sacstatenews/Articles/2012/03/StayWithItMatsui03-14-12.html|title=Campaign Encourages Future Engineers|first=Craig|last=Koscho|date=March 14, 2012|work=Sac State News}}</ref>
==See also== {{portal|Education |Engineering|Government of the United States}} {{clear}}
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== * {{URL|staywithit.org}}, the campaign's official website * [https://www.facebook.com/Engineering/app_260691170608423 webcast] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CtBJ3ucyl3c&feature=BFa&list=HL1332365138&lf=mh_lolz message from President Barack Obama]
